Summary: Round dull lighted object with a split/separation horzontally across the middle.
divs: sighting detailsaround 10 p.m. on a windy, cloudy and rainy night i was letting my two dogs out for the night before going to bed. normally, i let them out and wait for them to come back in but it was somewhat warm for november and i was standing in my driveway waiting for them just looking up into the sky. it was windy but not raining at the time and the clouds were racing across the sky. i was looking up in the sky to my southeast when an object appeared after a cloud had raced by. my first thought was that it was a strobe light that a car dealership uses sometimes for a promotion, they do use these in my town and i have seen them in the sky before. the object was round and had horizontal split \ seperation across the middle. the split wasn't real wide but it was noticable. as the object appeared from the cloud racing by it was stationary at first and then moved slightly as if hesistating then it moved steadily down slightly to my right. it dissappeared from my sight before the houses in front of me would have obscured my view. i am up on a hill so i have a decent view of the sky. the reason i am ruling out a car dealership strobe light is becasue a strobe light tends to move left and right across the sky and is somewhat bright. this was what made this object strange to me. i said it hesitated at first then move forward and arced downward - not side to side like a strobe light. the other feature of this object was the way it glowed. it had the glow of a garage door light. it reminded me of the glow my garage door light gives off with the cover over the light bulb, not bright and somewhat dull. the seperation across the middle was unique as well. after i realized this was not a strobe light i felt a fear run through my body and especially into my stomach. i continued to look into the sky for another few minutes but i did not see anything more. it is difficult to describe the size of this object and how far up it was in the sky. after thinking about it for a while and using a plane as a comparison i would have to say it was the size of four airplanes but round. i went in the house and told my wife and daughter and they could tell i wasn't kidding. my daughter and i tend to hold similiar views on this type of thing and she asked a few questions and that was the end of it. i have never seen a ufo before, i have always wanted too. to me, this was a ufo.
